def: A ball which has passed through all the hoops and would go outif it hit the stake but is continued in play; also, the player ofsuch a ball.
To attack with the tongue; to abuse; to insult.
The state or quality of being noisy.

A soft, heavy, brilliant glass, consisting essentially of asilicate of lead and potassium. It is used for tableware, and foroptical instruments, as prisms, its density giving a high degree ofdispersive power; -- so called, because formerly the silica wasobtained from pulverized flints. Called also crystal glass. Cf.Glass.

One of a school of physicians in Italy, about the middle of the17th century, who tried to apply the laws of mechanics andmathematics to the human body, and hence were eager student ofanatomy; -- opposed to the iatrochemists.
The act of investing again with a body; the state of beingfurnished anew with a body. [R.] Boyle.
The practice of meanly fawning on another; base sycophancy;servile adulation.
